sentences.en: Comparatively rudimentary interferometer observations suggested that this source is about 1.5 across.
sentences.cn: 不很精确的射电干涉仪观测表明,这个源的角径约为1.5弧秒.

sentences.en: Even the most rudimentary questions were impossible for them to answer.
sentences.cn: 他们甚至连最基本的问题都回答不出来.

sentences.en: Gradually, I acquired a rudimentary knowledge of music.
sentences.cn: 我逐渐掌握了基本的音乐知识。

sentences.en: He had only a rudimentary knowledge of French.
sentences.cn: 他对法语只是略知皮毛。

sentences.en: He has a rudimentary ability to read, but he can only read simple words.
sentences.cn: 他有基本的阅读能力, 但他只能看懂简单的词.

sentences.en: He has only a rudimentary knowledge of the subject.
sentences.cn: 他对这一科只有初步的认识.

sentences.en: I have only a rudimentary grasp of chemistry.
sentences.cn: 我只掌握了化学的初步知识.

sentences.en: I have only a rudimentary knowledge of chemistry.
sentences.cn: 我只有些粗浅的化学知识.

sentences.en: In humans, the pars intermedia is a rudimentary region.
sentences.cn: 人的脑垂体中间部是不发达的.

sentences.en: Rudimentary organs plainly declare their origin and meaning in various ways.
sentences.cn: 退化器官以各种方式明显地揭示了它们的起源和意义.

sentences.en: She had only rudimentary cosmetics, dry and cracking with disuse.
sentences.cn: 她只有一些起码的, 因为久已不用而干裂的化妆品.

sentences.en: The rules of evidence were rudimentary.
Their signal service was rudimentary. Radar was unknown to them.
sentences.cn: 他们的通信设施很不健全, 他们还不知道有雷达.

sentences.en: These ambiguities were partly inherent in the rudimentary state of strategic doctrine.
sentences.cn: 这些理论上的含混之处,一部分是战略理论在初创阶段上所固有的.

sentences.en: They were given only rudimentary training in the job.
sentences.cn: 他们仅仅受到过基本的职业训练。

sentences.en: We have available today only rudimentary concepts and models.
sentences.cn: 目前我们只有一些不成熟的概念和模型可资应用.

words.tran_cn: 基本的；初步的；退化的；残遗的；[昆]未发展的

trans.tran_cn: 基本的，初步的，发育不完全的，未成熟的，退化的
trans.tran_en: a rudimentary knowledge or understanding of a subject is very simple and basic
